plugins.name: Head Start
plugins.description:
Cover designs all over the place? Updating project statuses got you down? Creating the same pages and messing around with creating sections over an over? This plugin is for you!


Easily start projects with consistent cover pages and a readme file 


Add sections and pages for things like Eng Handoff, Explore, User Testing etc at the click of a button


Update the status of the project and have it reflected on the cover quickly and easily 



The plugin source code is available here:

https://github.com/jzingarelli/headStart


Please comment with any questions or feature requests, I will try to address them!

plugins.name: Imgazilla - Favicon exporter, background removal & multi-format image exporting with optimization.
plugins.description:
Features


Background removal

  1. Remove background from images.
  2. Save result or add to page in just one click.
  3. Unlimited usage rights.
  4. Secure (Plugin doesn't save copy of images).


Image compressor & exporter


  1. Shrink your images up to 95% more effectively than Figma’s default exports.
  2. Effortlessly downsize and compress your Figma images, layers, supporting multiple sizes and formats.
  3. Automatically save your optimized images as a convenient .zip file.
  4. Compatible with various formats, including PNG, JPG, SVG, WEBP, AVIF.
  5. Export as PNG, JPG, SVG, WebP, AVIF


Favicon exporter

  1. Generate favicon from selected icon.
  2. Supports various sizes.
  3. Preview your favicon to see how it will appear on your site.
  4. Includes additional files for Android, iOS, and manifest.json for PWA compatibility.
  5. Provides HTML code for easy integration.


Support


If you have any questions or encounter any issues while using Imgazilla, please don’t hesitate to reach out to me at support@imgazilla.app. I'm here to help!
plugins.tagline: Export Favicons, background removal & optimize JPG, PNG, SVG, WEBP, AVIF files directly from Figma.

plugins.name: XTM Connect - Figma
plugins.description:
Figma and XTM Cloud – Picture Perfect

Figma’s design features bring ideas to life and make content sing.

XTM Cloud’s translation technology keeps the voices in tune for any audience.

With Figma and XTM Cloud, you can go where your imagination takes you.

  1. Synchronise between Figma and XTM Cloud and start translating design content from the moment of creation
  2. Give linguists visual context so they can tailor messages to multilingual audiences
  3. Make an image and a brand equally appealing and resonant in Berlin, Beijing and Buenos Aires


Intelligent Automation For Design Content

  1. Transfer of content from Figma to XTM Cloud is instantaneous
  2. XTM Cloud transcreation delivers creativity and a range of alternative translations to choose from
  3. Multilingual content is returned to Figma at the click of a button


You’re The Voice

  1. Project managers, linguists and designers all have valuable opinions to share
  2. XTM Connect - Figma unites each team members – and each voice – in pursuit of excellence
  3. No thread is lost, no question left unanswered 


Get It Fast And Get It Right

  1. Linguists work on content while designers are working on images
  2. Designers have instant visibility of translated content and how it will appear in context
  3. Talented people working more quickly, working more productively and working together


What’s Your 2020s Vision?

  1. Share it with confidence
  2. Share it with persuasiveness
  3. Share it with the world


These customers trust us, and so can you

GAP, Swiss Post, Kyocera, Crown, Sony Interactive Entertainment, Expedia Group, BigPoint, RICOH


Getting the most out of XTM Connect - Figma

To take full advantage of XTM Connect - Figma, create an account on XTM Cloud. Get in touch with our Partner team and they’ll give you all the help you want.

For more information or for a free trial of XTM Cloud, check out our website: xtm.cloud

plugins.name: Hide Layer from Instances
plugins.description:
Iterations always demand new additions to components. All of us have encountered cases where we need to add something to a component but don’t want that to show up in all the hundreds and thousands of existing instances. We finally end up creating a new component so that the existing work is not affected. This plugin solves this issue with a single click.

Follow these steps to hide a particular layer from all component instances
• Select the layer/group/frame that you want to hide from one of the instances of a component
• Select Hide Layers from Instances -> Hide
• The selected layer/group/frame will be hidden from all instances in the current page

Use the Force Hide option if the layer that you want to hide is part of a component that is nested in multiple other components and you want to hide the layer in all of them at once.
Eg.: If you want to hide a layer in an icon component that is already used in various other components like different state and sizes of buttons, then Hide option will just hide the layer in the selected state or size of the button. Whereas Force Hide will hide the layer in all the instances of all the components that this icon is used.

This plugin works only on instances and not on components
CAUTION: When using the Force Hide option. ensure that the name of the layer you are hiding is unique. If not, multiple layers may get hidden.

Feels too small a feature for a plugin? There is also a Scripter File for this that you can use. https://www.figma.com/community/file/858014268242545394/Hide-Layers-from-Instances

Do let us know if you want any additional features. We'll try adding it. Cheers! :)

plugins.name: Figma Sprinkle - Random image & text
plugins.description:
Enhance Your Prototypes with Random Images & Text

Easily apply random images and dummy text to improve the quality of your prototype screens. This plugin allows you to quickly upload multiple background images and apply them randomly, as well as insert placeholder text into text layers.


🌟 How to Apply Random Images

  1. Select the frames or shapes where you want to apply random background images.
  2. Go to the Random Image tab and click Choose files to select image files from your computer.
  3. Click Apply Random, and the selected images will automatically be set as backgrounds.


📝 How to Apply Random Text

  1. Select the text layers where you want to insert dummy text.
  2. Choose a dummy text type, then click Apply Random Text.
  3. Random words or sentences will be automatically applied to the text box.


💡 I’d love your feedback!

This plugin is still in the testing phase. If you encounter any issues or have suggestions, your feedback would be greatly appreciated! 🚀

Report an Issue / Suggest an Improvement >
plugins.tagline: random,background image, text

plugins.name: Jet Admin Export
plugins.description:
Easily export your Figma designs to Jet Admin No-Code web apps builder. Add data binding and interactions to your Figma component designs to make them work in a real web application.


How it works:

  1. In Jet Admin: open Component Designer to add or edit your custom component
  2. Click Menu -> Import from Figma
  3. Copy Import key
  4. In Figma: Select single layer you want to export (Frame, Group, Section, etc.)
  5. Run Jet Admin Export plugin
  6. Enter Import key from Jet Admin
  7. Click Export selected
  8. In Jet admin: reload Figma imports in Import from Figma popup and click import on the imported design
plugins.tagline: Create No-Code web apps with Figma design

plugins.name: Analytiks
plugins.description:
Analytiks gives you a bird's eye view on your Figma file and helps you understand the status and health of the work you and others put in with easy-to-read analytics at a glance.


Jumping in a new project and you want to know what's the situation with the design system? Do you want to spot how many groups there are or hidden files? Analytiks helps you answer all these questions and more with smart, beautiful and useful analytics for every Figma file.


Analysis of Figma files takes from a couple of seconds to a few minutes depending on the size and complexity of the Figma file. Be mindful of the complexity of big files and decide if you want to run the plugin.

plugins.name: Betafi: Import Notes and Embed Clips
plugins.description:
Bring user feedback to where product teams (Fig)jam

Import notes and clips from user feedback sessions into your FigJam board to easily review user requirements and usability feedback with your team and stakeholders.


How it works: Watch the demo

  1. Install the plugin and log in to your Betafi account (or sign up for Free).
  2. Select the project containing the notes/clips you want to bring over to FigJam.
  3. Click “Import All” or drag and drop selected notes/clips to FigJam.


Why Betafi?

  • Whether you use Betafi or Zoom (or Google Meet coming soon), you can use Betafi to capture the ‘aha moments’ and take notes within pre-created questions. Then import your notes to FigJam.
  • Post-call, dig out the ‘aha’ moments from your feedback calls using the recording synced with the transcript and your notes. And then import these important moments to FigJam.
  • You can also bring your Figma prototypes to Betafi, conduct moderated usability testing sessions, then clip videos of user struggles, and import the mini-clips to FigJam.


Your user insights should live on FigJam.

Try Betafi for FREE to avoid switching between multiple tools.

Learn More
plugins.tagline: Transform Your FigJam Board into a User Insights Powerhouse

plugins.name: Variables Generator
plugins.description:
Automate creating local variables by using JSON and speed up your workflow. Simply use the formats below to generate your variables, colors must be in a hex format and can support alpha channels via 8 digits.


⚠️ NOTE: This plugin only supports color variables, future updates may eventually support all variable types.


Demo

View this video demo of the plugin working with aliasing.


Single Mode

{
"VariableName": "Hex",
"VariableName": "Hex"
}


Multiple Modes

{
"VariableName": {
"Mode": "Hex",
"Mode": "Hex"
},
"VariableName": {
"Mode": "Hex",
"Mode": "Hex"
}
}


Aliasing

You can use aliasing across your local variables as long as their names are unique.


{
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias",
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias",
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias"
}


  1. VariableName is the name of your variable
  2. $VariableAlias is the name of the alias you are aliasing, be sure to include the $ to enable aliasing
  3. Mode is the name of your mode, each variable must contain the same modes
  4. Hex is the hex code of your color, supports 8-digit hex codes for transparency


Examples


Single mode that creates a color palette:


{
"black": "#0e1112",
"white": "#d4d7d6",
"grey": "#4d5a5e",
"blue": "#519aba",
"green": "#8dc149",
"orange": "#e37933",
"pink": "#f55385",
"purple": "#a074c4",
"red": "#cc3e44",
"steel": "#7494a3",
"yellow": "#cbcb41"
}


Multiple modes that use 8-digit hex codes:


{
"tab-activeBackground": {
"Dark": "#1f1f1f",
"Light": "#ffffff",
"Monokai": "#272822"
},
"tab-activeBorder": {
"Dark": "#1f1f1f",
"Light": "#f8f8f8",
"Monokai": "#00000000"
},
"tab-activeBorderTop": {
"Dark": "#0078d4",
"Light": "#005fb8",
"Monokai": "#00000000"
},
"tab-activeForeground": {
"Dark": "#ffffff",
"Light": "#3b3b3b",
"Monokai": "#ffffff"
},
"tab-border": {
"Dark": "#2b2b2b",
"Light": "#e5e5e5",
"Monokai": "#1e1f1c"
}
}


Using aliasing across collections:


Colors collection:


{
"black": "#0e1112",
"white": "#d4d7d6",
"grey": "#4d5a5e"
}


Tokens collection that references Colors variables:


{
"button": {
"Dark": "$black",
"Light": "$white",
"Monokai": "$grey"
}
}

accepted.name: Miguel Solorio
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Generate local Figma variables using JSON

plugins.name: AIquiry
plugins.description:
Introducing a powerful Figma plugin, which integrates with OpenAI API to offer you the best AI-powered design tools available. 


With this plugin, you can create stunning color palettes using advanced machine learning algorithms based on any starting color. Additionally, you can generate unique, high-quality images using the Davinci AI model by simply providing a prompt. 


Moreover, if you have any design-related questions or prompts, this plugin can use OpenAI's text capabilities to provide you with accurate, insightful answers.


To get started, simply register with OpenAI to obtain your API token and start exploring the endless possibilities with this AI-powered Figma plugin AIquiry.

plugins.name: Figma -> AI Prompt Generator
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma designs into AI-generated prompts effortlessly! This plugin acts as a bridge between your visual designs and coding needs. Simply select elements in Figma, and let the AI generate detailed prompts that describe how to code your UI components, layouts, or entire pages. Whether you're looking to create React components, CSS styles, or need a starting point for custom development, this plugin converts your design selections into clear, actionable code prompts. Enhance your workflow, speed up development, and ensure consistency by harnessing the power of AI in your design-to-code process.


Open Source

https://github.com/TheunsBarnardt/AI-Prompt-Generator

plugins.name: Arcade: Turn designs into interactive demos
plugins.description:
From passive to interactive storytelling: Export your designs to Arcade and turn them into engaging, on-brand demos.


Arcade is an interactive demo platform that allows teams to create effortlessly beautiful demos in minutes.


Arcade’s Figma plugin allows you to transform static designs into interactive, clickable demos, enabling faster feedback, better collaboration, and more engaging product storytelling.


To get started, select the frames or layers to export to Arcade. With the click of a button, the plug-in will convert them to an interactive demo.


Teams are using the Arcade plugin for:

☆ Design reviews

☆ Gathering customer feedback on new features

☆ Sharing product roadmap in sales conversations

☆ Product launches

☆ Personalizing UI for collateral and customer demos


This plugin is built for designers, marketers, and product teams that need to showcase product functionality and design in an interactive way.


Getting started with Arcade:

Arcade has free and paid plan options. Sign up for free at https://www.arcade.software


Here are some feature highlights from each plan:


Free plan:

  1. Upload media: images, videos, pdfs.
  2. Camera recording
  3. Video editing
  4. Synthetic voiceovers
  5. Hotspots and callouts
  6. Background colors/music


Paid plans:


  1. Pan and zoom
  2. GIF and video export
  3. Blur (redaction)
  4. Custom branding
  5. Forms and form embeds
  6. Commenting
  7. HTML editing


… and more!


We can’t wait to see what you build.
plugins.tagline: Create effortlessly beautiful demos in minutes.

plugins.description:
convert text to design with my new plugin , endless possibilities :

https://www.figma.com/community/plugin/1405952503129758628/barttexttodesignnow



Introducing major updates! Now you can load data for your charts directly from JSON and CSV files. Simply upload your JSON file with the format:


{

"heights": [150, 200, 100, 250, 300, 175, 225]

}


or your CSV file with the following structure:


Height

150

200

100

250

300

175

225



Introducing the Create Rectangle Chart Generator: the ultimate tool designed to transform the way you visualize and present your data. With our cutting-edge technology and user-friendly interface, creating rectangle charts has never been more accessible or efficient. Whether you're a professional looking to illustrate complex data in a clear, impactful way, or a student aiming to bring your projects to life with vivid charts, our generator is your perfect companion.


Our tool stands out by offering a seamless experience from start to finish. Begin with raw data and watch as it transforms into a beautifully organized rectangle chart in just a few clicks. Customize your charts with a variety of colors, sizes, and labels to match your presentation theme or personal preference. With dynamic chart generation capabilities, our tool adapts to your data in real-time, ensuring that every chart you create is accurate and up-to-date.


But we don't stop at functionality. We understand the importance of aesthetics in data presentation. That's why our generator includes a range of customization options to ensure your charts not only convey information effectively but do so with style. From sleek, professional designs to more creative and colorful options, the Create Rectangle Chart Generator caters to all tastes and requirements.


Ideal for educators, researchers, marketers, and anyone in need of presenting data in a visually appealing format, our generator is designed to save you time while enhancing the quality of your presentations. Say goodbye to complicated software and tedious processes. With our Create Rectangle Chart Generator, beautiful, informative rectangle charts are just a few clicks away. Elevate your data presentation game and make your charts stand out. Try it today and see the difference for yourself!

plugins.name: ToC+
plugins.description:
A plugin to help designers and viewers organize and navigate Figma files.


Features


Generate pages by sections in one-click

  • Customizable section names.
  • Parse existing file page sections, and saves previously used sections.
  • Allow hiding certain sections/pages/artboards from the ToC by starting the name with `_`.

Generate table-of-contents

  • Organized by section > page > artboard.
  • Each page/artboard is clickable, links directly to that item.
  • Allow include/exclude artboard/page/sections by the name.
  • Re-run anytime to fresh.

Placeholder cover page

  • "Last updated" auto updates whenever the plugin runs.

  1. Preview: See how your generated code looks immediately.


  1. AI Prompt: Create AI prompts to optimize your code specifically for React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS projects.


  1. Easy Copy: Copy generated code or styles with just one click.

plugins.name: cad.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import AutoCad files (.dwf, .dwfx, .dwg, .dxf) to Figma
plugins.description:
Import your CAD files as fully editable Figma designs.

Go directly from AutoCAD to Figma and convert any .dxf or .dwg file into Figma layers!


How to import AutoCAD files into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, cad.to.design
  2. Drag-and-drop any .dwf, .dwfx, .dwg or .dxf file onto the plugin
  3. Your CAD file will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use cad.to.design?

  1. Go directly from programs like AutoCAD to Figma - no additional converter tools required.
  2. Fast, high-quality conversion from AutoCAD (.dwf, .dwfx, .dwg, .dxf) to Figma, keeping your designs precise.
  3. Perfect if you want to use AutoCAD mockups in your Figma designs!


FREE

  1. 5 free imports

  2. Multiple files at once
  3. $49 for 1-year (not recurring) or $99 for 3-years (not recurring)

plugins.name: QQT Fanyi
plugins.description:
这是一个为简体中文设计的翻译插件，它包含两个功能：

1）将画布中的内容翻译为繁体/英文；

2）将画布名称翻译为繁体/英文。


使用方法：

1）启动插件。

2）选择单个或者多个画布。

3）选择需要翻译的目标语言。

4）如果只翻译画布名称则打开“只翻译画布名称”，翻译内容则可忽略。

5）点击“翻译”后即可完成设计稿适配。


*本插件只支持源语言为简体中文的字段


This is a translation plugin designed for Simplified Chinese. It contains two functions:

1) Translate the content in the canvas into Traditional Chinese/English;

2) Translate the canvas name into Traditional Chinese/English.


How to use:

1) Start the plugin.

2) Select one or more canvases.

3) Select the target language to be translated.

4) If you only want to translate the canvas name, turn on "Translate canvas name only" and ignore the translation content.

5) Click "Translate" to complete the design adaptation.


*This plugin only supports fields with the source language in Simplified Chinese

2) Translate the canvas name into Traditional Chinese/English.


How to use:

1) Start the plugin.

2) Select one or more canvases.

3) Select the target language to be translated.

4) If you only want to translate the canvas name, turn on "Translate canvas name only" and ignore the translation content.

5) Click "Translate" to complete the design adaptation.


*This plugin only supports fields with the source language in Simplified Chinese

plugins.name: CVA: Component Variants Automator
plugins.description:
It's time to save you some time!

Don't take "authority" too seriously, we are here to give you control!


With CVA you'll get to control how you want your components to vary without having to modify each variant by hand.


For now, if you create your component using the Cascading Components strategy you get to generate a Component Set with all possible variants. That's pretty useful to quickly check how your component will look and to document your design system.


You can also limit the number of generations by linking properties therefore avoiding generating a big button with a tiny text, for example.


🛝 Go to our playground to learn how to use CVA step by step!

🍿 Learn how to use CVA from our tutorial on Youtube.


We are in a lot of places, follow us on 🕵️

Instagram for tips 🧚

Twitter / X for updates 📣

Medium for some reading 📖

Youtube for tutorials 👩‍🏫

Discord for befriending us 🧞‍♂️

And please, ask for features and feedback on cva.canny.io 📮


But we are just starting and there's a lot more to come. We keep working to bring you more straightforward solutions for your designing needs, cause less clicks means more time for your creativity to flourish.


🕵️ PS: Our name is a reference to TVA, the Time Variance Authority. If you haven't watched the TV show Loki to get the reference, we highly recommend it!

plugins.name: MM Color Interpolation Grid
plugins.description:
Generate harmonious color palettes and explore smooth color transitions grids directly inside Figma.


This plugin lets you create custom color interpolation grids using up to four corner colors. It’s perfect for designers exploring palette variations, easing models, or just geeking out on color theory.


Features:

  1. Choose top-left, top-right, bottom-left, and bottom-right colors.
  2. Generate harmonious starting color palettes with unique names in one click.
  3. Interpolate using multiple models: oklab, oklch, rgb, and more.
  4. Apply easing functions for smoother or creative transitions.
  5. Copy individual hex codes with one click.
  6. Insert the entire grid into your Figma file as named rectangles.
  7. Optionally create color styles for every cell, grouped by grid.


Great for:

  1. Building brand palettes
  2. Creating beautiful UI color scales/ramps
  3. Visualizing color transitions for design systems


A project by Alex Cristache & Mindful Motif.


A shout out to the creators of Culori and Color Name API for their invaluable resources.

accepted.name: Alex Cristache
accepted.description:
Founder & Principal Consultant (Design) 
at MindfulMotif. Seasoned designer and digital strategist. Explorer of art & color through #MindfulPalettes on X.

plugins.tagline: Explore smooth color transitions and generate harmonious palettes directly inside Figma.

plugins.name: Token Studio Inspect
plugins.description:
Token Studio Inspect is a Figma plugin enabling users to generate tokens in the Inspect panel natively. It adds tokens to component descriptions, making it easy to inspect, select, and copy them. Tokens Studio Inspect detects token data from the Tokens Studio Figma Plugin. If no data is available, nothing is added to the component description.


Key features:

  • Generate tokens studio inspect. It will add token data to all components detected in files based on the tokens you apply in the component.
  • Delete tokens studio inspect. It will erase all token data from the component description of all components detected in the files.


Demo:

Watch the demo video here.


Limitation:

Tokens Studio can be applied to any layer in Figma. However, Tokens Studio Inspect are limited to components only, as Figma only allows descriptions within components.

accepted.name: Reza Faiz Atta Rahman
accepted.description: Designer ✌️

plugins.tagline: Generate Tokens Studio inspect natively in Figma’s inspect panel

  • Sick of using the same paragraph of text over and over again? Generate completely unique copy blocks for multiple text frames at once.
  • Need headlines? Choose between title or sentence casing, and even decide whether or not to include periods.
  • Don't settle for awkward one-word sentences at the end of paragraphs. Custom logic evaluates the structure of all generated text to make sure it will look and feel just right.

plugins.name: Sequence frames
plugins.description:
Sequence frames

For mass creation of frames

  • You can enter values with any separators. Each pair of numbers will be considered as width and height, they will also be in the frame name.
  • Values can be copied from excel tables vertically or horizontally.
  • When entering values, it immediately shows how many frames will be created and with what sizes.
  • A value that has no pair (undefined) will not lead to the creation of a frame.


Для массового создания фреймов

  • Вписывать значения можно с любыми разделителями. Каждая пара чисел будет считаться шириной и высотой, они же будут в названии фрейма.

  • При вписывании значений сразу показывает сколько фреймов будет создано и с какими размерами.

Are you tired of the endless back-and-forth between designers and developers, desperately seeking a way to accelerate your design system creation process? Look no further! UICE is here to revolutionize your workflow, making design system development a breeze. With this groundbreaking plugin, you can now slash your design system building time to just 1/10 of what it used to be, ensuring a smoother, more efficient collaboration between your design and development teams.


🚀 Unlock Effortless Efficiency: UICE is your secret weapon for reducing friction between designers and devs. It's a game-changer, streamlining your workflow and supercharging your design system development.


🌟 Top-Notch User Experiences, Effortlessly: UICE empowers you to deliver top-notch user experiences to your end-users with ease. Our revolutionary tool bridges the gap between design and development, ensuring your project stands out in the crowded digital landscape.


🔥 Key Features that Set UICE Apart:

  1. Automated UI Component Extraction: UICE is like having a magical genie at your service. It automatically extracts UI components from your Figma designs, eliminating the need for tedious, manual labor.

UICE isn't just a design system generator; it's a catalyst for success. Experience the future of design system development with UICE, and watch your projects flourish like never before. Say farewell to inefficiencies and embrace the fast track to design system perfection!

plugins.name: SVG Auto Fix Path Directions (fill-rule)
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin to fix path directions, commonly named 'fill-rule' and 'winding order' in Figma.

You can use your existing export config, this plugin will export files to every format to a single ZIP file. It will also warn if files are duplicated because they have the same name.


This plugin is still in beta and is not tested for every usecase. If you have any bugs please get in touch :)


There isn't any customization yet. It uses the default SVGO fixes.




Source code is available at https://github.com/RemyyB/Figma-Plugin-FixPathDirections, feel free to update the plugin and tweak it, I do accept PR's. I am tweaking this plugin, it is still in beta, but don't expect a feature-rich plugin just yet.
plugins.tagline: A very simple plugin to fix path directions in Figma. Includes SVGO and exports into a ZIP file.
